org.ingatan.component.image
Class EditorCanvas

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.image.EditorCanvas
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class EditorCanvas
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This extension of JPanel performs the following:

  • Allows the user to write to an encapsualted BufferedImage using various tools
  • Renders the BufferedImage to itself.
  • Keeps an undo-redo record in the form of previous buffered images.
  • Keeps track of the current selection (if any) that is made.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

setZoomFactor

public void setZoomFactor(float zoomFactor)
The canvas will multiply its size and intercept and alter MouseEvents, based on the zoom factor set here. The zoom factor is a float which multiplies the image width and height upon repaint, and alters any mouse event coordinates correspondingly. A zoom factor of 1 will give the actual size of the image, 2 will double the size of the image, etc.

Parameters:
zoomFactor - a float which multiplies the image width and height upon repaint. Must be a value greater than 0 and less than 10.

getZoomFactor

public float getZoomFactor()
Gets the float that multiplies image width and height upon repaint, and is the divisor of the coordinates of any mouse input event.

Returns:
the zoom factor.
